critique: The document is an executive order regarding the exemption of John W. Woermann from mandatory retirement. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is a sense of confidence and assurance that the government is functioning efficiently and effectively. There is a tone of authority and decisiveness. The language is formal and legalistic, reinforcing the seriousness of the matter. The context is a specific personnel decision within the government. The President likely wants to convey a sense of stability and competence in managing government affairs. The scores are based on the assumption that the President wants to project an image of control and judiciousness.
